gaming_cpus.description: Great value for high refresh rate gaming.

gaming_cpus.name: Intel Core i5-13600K
gaming_cpus.description: Budget-friendly option for high frame rates.

gaming_cpus.description: Ideal for 1080p and 1440p gaming with strong single-core performance.

gaming_cpus.name: Intel Core i5-11400
gaming_cpus.description: Budget-friendly pick for 1080p esports titles.

gaming_cpus.description: Capable entry-level CPU for older games and esports.

gaming_cpus.description: Budget-conscious option for basic 1080p gaming.

gaming_cpus.name: AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D
gaming_cpus.description: Excellent alternative for high frame rate gaming on AM4 platform.

gaming_cpus.name: Intel Core i5-12600K
gaming_cpus.description: Still a strong contender for mid-range gaming builds.

gaming_cpus.name: AMD Ryzen 5 5600G
gaming_cpus.description: Integrated graphics make it a good choice for budget builds without a dedicated GPU.

gaming_cpus.name: AMD Ryzen 9 5900X
gaming_cpus.description: Successor to the 7700 with potentially higher core count and performance.

gaming_cpus.name: Intel Core i7 12700K
gaming_cpus.description: Next-gen Core i5 with potential for improved clock speeds and performance.

gaming_cpus.name: AMD Ryzen Threadripper 5995WX
gaming_cpus.description: This CPU caters to enthusiasts and professionals who need exceptional multi-core performance for demanding tasks like video editing, 3D rendering, and high-end gaming with heavy streaming/recording.

gaming_cpus.name: Intel Core i9-12900K
gaming_cpus.description: This CPU offers a strong balance of cores and performance, making it ideal for gamers who also edit videos, stream, or work with creative applications.

gaming_cpus.name: AMD Ryzen 5 5500
gaming_cpus.description: This CPU is a good choice for budget-minded gamers who plan to upgrade their graphics card later. The AM4 platform allows for future upgrades to higher-end Ryzen processors on the same motherboard (depending on compatibility).
